intro: Primula violaris, commonly known as the purple primrose, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy beneath. It thrives in woodland or shady garden environments, preferring well-drained, moist soil. The flowers are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and can attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
